item.title: Calling Haskell from Swift
item.description: TODO Second part of an in-depth guide into developing native applications using Haskell with Swift.
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Mesquita

item.title: Computed Properties for Haskell Records
item.description: Adding computed properties to Haskell record types -- probably a new Haskell anti-pattern!
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Mesquita

item.title: Creating a macOS app with Haskell and Swift
item.description: First part of an in-depth guide into developing a native macOS application using Haskell with Swift and SwiftUI. This part covers the set-up required to call Haskell functions from Swift in an XCode project using SwiftUI.
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Mesquita

item.title: Writing prettier Haskell with Unicode Syntax and Vim
item.description: A short write-up on combining digraphs, a feature built-in to vim, and Haskell's UnicodeSyntax extension, to easily write beautiful Haskell programs with unicode symbols.
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Mesquita

item.title: Monthly Update on a Haskell Game Engine
item.description: I've been working the past month or two in a shader-centric, type-heavy 3d-renderer/game engine, written in Haskell. In this post I present some of the current implementation details and pictures of the multiple achievements and progress done so far.
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Mesquita

item.title: Equality Saturation in Haskell, a tutorial
item.description: A first tutorial for equality saturation with hegg, a library of e-graphs and fast equality saturation written in Haskell. This tutorial implements a symbolic manipulation library using hegg.
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Mesquita

item.title: Graphical Applications in Haskell with FRP and Reflex
item.description: This is the second of two parts on creating interactive graphical applications with functional programming, in Haskell; this second part, using Functional Reactive Programming through reflex, and how it can be used to build a DOM-based interactive UI.
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Mesquita

item.title: Graphical Applications in Haskell with MVC and Gloss
item.description: This is the first of two parts on creating interactive graphical applications with functional programming, in Haskell; this first part, using the Model-View-Controller pattern in its functional flavour through gloss. The MVC pattern is common accross all languages and goes by many names. For example, it's how smartphone applications are structured in Android Studio.
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Mesquita

item.title: Haskell 102 Lecture Notes
item.description: Lecture notes from an introductory class on Haskell
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Mesquita

item.title: Haskell 101 Lecture Notes
item.description: Lecture notes from an introductory class on Haskell
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Mesquita
